verses.verse: Come down <S%H3381><s%>, and sit <S%H3427><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>, O virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, sit <S%H3427><s%> on the ground <S%H776><s%>: there is no throne <S%H3678><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>: for thou shalt no more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%> tender <S%H7390><s%> and delicate <S%H6028><s%>.

Take <S%H3947><s%> the millstones <S%H7347><s%>, and grind <S%H2912><s%> meal <S%H7058><s%>: uncover <S%H1540><s%> thy locks <S%H6777><s%>, make bare <S%H2834><s%> the leg <S%H7640><s%>, uncover <S%H1540><s%> the thigh <S%H7785><s%>, pass over <S%H5674><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%>.

Thy nakedness <S%H6172><s%> shall be uncovered <S%H1540><s%>, yea, thy shame <S%H2781><s%> shall be seen <S%H7200><s%>: I will take <S%H3947><s%> vengeance <S%H5359><s%>, and I will not meet <S%H6293><s%> thee as a man <S%H120><s%>.
As for our redeemer <S%H1350><s%>, the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is his name <S%H8034><s%>, the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Sit <S%H3427><s%> thou silent <S%H1748><s%>, and get <S%H935><s%> thee into darkness <S%H2822><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>: for thou shalt no more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%>, The lady <S%H1404><s%> of kingdoms <S%H4467><s%>.

I was wroth <S%H7107><s%> with my people <S%H5971><s%>, I have polluted <S%H2490><s%> mine inheritance <S%H5159><s%>, and given <S%H5414><s%> them into thine hand <S%H3027><s%>: thou didst shew <S%H7760><s%> them no mercy <S%H7356><s%>; upon the ancient <S%H2205><s%> hast thou very <S%H3966><s%> heavily <S%H3513><s%> laid thy yoke <S%H5923><s%>.

And thou saidst <S%H559><s%>, I shall be a lady <S%H1404><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>: so that thou didst not lay <S%H7760><s%> these things to thy heart <S%H3820><s%>, neither didst remember <S%H2142><s%> the latter end <S%H319><s%> of it.

Therefore hear <S%H8085><s%> now this, thou that art given to pleasures <S%H5719><s%>, that dwellest <S%H3427><s%> carelessly <S%H983><s%>, that sayest <S%H559><s%> in thine heart <S%H3824><s%>, I am, and none else <S%H657><s%> beside me; I shall not sit <S%H3427><s%> as a widow <S%H490><s%>, neither shall I know <S%H3045><s%> the loss of children <S%H7908><s%>:

But these two <S%H8147><s%> things shall come <S%H935><s%> to thee in a moment <S%H7281><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, the loss of children <S%H7908><s%>, and widowhood <S%H489><s%>: they shall come <S%H935><s%> upon thee in their perfection <S%H8537><s%> for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy sorceries <S%H3785><s%>, and for the great <S%H3966><s%> abundance <S%H6109><s%> of thine enchantments <S%H2267><s%>.

For thou hast trusted <S%H982><s%> in thy wickedness <S%H7451><s%>: thou hast said <S%H559><s%>, None seeth <S%H7200><s%> me. Thy wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and thy knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, it hath perverted <S%H7725><s%> thee; and thou hast said <S%H559><s%> in thine heart <S%H3820><s%>, I am, and none else <S%H657><s%> beside me. perverted: or, caused thee to turn away

Therefore shall evil <S%H7451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon thee; thou shalt not know <S%H3045><s%> from whence it riseth <S%H7837><s%>: and mischief <S%H1943><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> upon thee; thou shalt not be able <S%H3201><s%> to put it off <S%H3722><s%>: and desolation <S%H7722><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> upon thee suddenly <S%H6597><s%>, which thou shalt not know <S%H3045><s%>. from: Heb. the morning thereof put: Heb. expiate

Stand <S%H5975><s%> now with thine enchantments <S%H2267><s%>, and with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy sorceries <S%H3785><s%>, wherein <S%H834><s%> thou hast laboured <S%H3021><s%> from thy youth <S%H5271><s%>; if so be thou shalt be able <S%H3201><s%> to profit <S%H3276><s%>, if so be thou mayest prevail <S%H6206><s%>.

Thou art wearied <S%H3811><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy counsels <S%H6098><s%>. Let now the astrologers <S%H1895><s%> <S%H8064><s%>, the stargazers <S%H2374><s%> <S%H3556><s%>, the monthly <S%H2320><s%> prognosticators <S%H3045><s%>, stand up <S%H5975><s%>, and save <S%H3467><s%> thee from these things that shall come <S%H935><s%> upon thee. astrologers: Heb. viewers of the heavens the monthly: Heb. that give knowledge concerning the months

Behold, they shall be as stubble <S%H7179><s%>; the fire <S%H784><s%> shall burn <S%H8313><s%> them; they shall not deliver <S%H5337><s%> themselves <S%H5315><s%> from the power <S%H3027><s%> of the flame <S%H3852><s%>: there shall not be a coal <S%H1513><s%> to warm <S%H2552><s%> at, nor fire <S%H217><s%> to sit <S%H3427><s%> before it. themselves: Heb. their souls

Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured <S%H3021><s%>, even thy merchants <S%H5503><s%>, from thy youth <S%H5271><s%>: they shall wander <S%H8582><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> to his quarter <S%H5676><s%>; none shall save <S%H3467><s%> thee.
